A few meters away, Yggdrasil watches as the group gets out of the 
ship. He focuses on the insignias they bear on their chest and arms.
It is obvious they are neither maximals nor predacons, but he doesn't 
know about them. He stays put. They seem to know he is somewhere 
around, but he was lucky enough not to have been truly noticed. 
Besides, their implied threat didn't bother him. He'd heard and lived 
through worse. And he had the big guns right now.

That's when he noticed he didn't anymore. Somehow, the Bullet had been 
destroyed in high orbit. Forget about the artillery. Although he felt 
like swearing out loud right now, he was too much in his mission of 
immobility to try anything. He was a little more vulnerable right now. 
If they get to find him, he would have to play it safe, but he would 
gladly try to escape against all odd the way Optimus Prime would do 
it.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> Torin ambles after her.  When they get outside, they find Devilcat 
> and Riekan already there.  Jayde and Fury arrive soon after.  The 
> thunder of jets soon announces Gatara's arrival as well.
> 
> "Ah, there you are." Devilcat says to the group in general.  
"Gatara, 
> may I assume everything went smoothly?"
> 
> "Got their heads on poles and their bodies blown away."  Gatara's 
> description matches her usual notion of proper corpse disposal - put 
> the head on display and disintegrate the rest.  It's a loud and 
clear 
> message not to mess with the Rogues.
> 
> OOC: Anyone who wants can stumble across this grisly exhibit in the 
> future.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jeff" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> > -- Noir --
> > 
> > "Alright." Noir says. "We'll leave the beacons here and get them 
> > after the situation is resolved."
> > 
> > She heads out of the storage bay, and starts making her way out of 
> > the Rogue Star with a quick pace.
